Articles.Content:
As some of you guys know, I am a student who (obviously) play both Kerbal games and I have also found several more guys in my school who are interested in the Kerbal franchise. From what I observe, there are a lot of people like me who are both KSP fans and students. However, I do see the lack of discussions dedicated for students. Thus, this very thread was created.

Since this thread is for students, whether you are a player, a modder, a content creator or just some random guy who likes the Kerbal universe, as long as you're a student, your post will be greatly welcomed!

(As a plus, the text above was written in my school!)
We're all students... some actually learn something, some learn nothing, the rest are drunk.

I have no idea if anyone else at my school likes or knows about KSP except my closest friends

I just hope high school or college might have a KSP club but Idk lol

(I'm in the 8th grade so I'm not <13, just letting you know)

On 11/24/2023 at 9:27 PM, TheSpaceDinos4037 said:

I just hope high school or college might have a KSP club but Idk lol

 

start one and show off to the college admissions people >:)

I’m a university/community college professor and I’ve introduced my students to KSP “unofficially” since I discovered the game in my Steam queue in 2012.(1)

(1) Unofficially, because my courses are in world civilization, U.S. history, and American foreign policy, not anything STEM-related!
No, but it's on my bucket list for the next semester if not this one

I'm at a small, local college in the Bay Area.

this was written on a crappy school surplus chromebook
